You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Set Up the My Account Menu in the Header

Provide quick access to the sections of the My Account page from anywhere on your Visualforce storefront or Experience Builder page. The B2B Commerce Header component in an Experience Builderpage and the header component in a Visualforce storefront page support a dropdown menu for the My Account link. Populate the dropdown menu with links to your supported My Account page sections, and save your buyers a few clicks during their storefront session.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only



USER PERMISSIONS
NEEDED
To edit object settings in permission sets:	Manage Profiles and Permission Sets
To create a menu:	Create on CC Menu
To create menu items:	Create on CC Menu Item
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

By default, the menu for the My Account link in the header requires the following records:

CC Menu
A record where the Show My Account Menu field is enabled.
CC Menu Items
Records assigned to the CC Menu where the Show My Account Menu field is enabled. The menu items specify relative URLs to the individual sections of the My Account page that your storefront supports.

If you've upgraded an existing B2B Commerce for Visualforce solution to Winter ’21 (version 4.13), first manually create the parent CC Menu record. Then, upload the data for the corresponding CC Menu Items. If B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) is the only version that's been installed in your org, the CC_Data_DefaultStore and CC_Data_DefaultStore_Min static resources already include the required records.

NOTE To manage specific sections on the My Account page itself, continue to use existing configuration settings.
Update any clones of the default B2B Commerce Admin permission set that you've created to add access to the CC Menu object's Show in My Account Menu field.
From Setup, enter Permission in the Quick Find box, and then select Permission Sets.
Select the clone of the default B2B Commerce Admin permission set.
Select Object Settings.
In the list of objects, select CC Menu, and then click Edit.
In the Field Permissions section, enable Read Access and Edit Access for the Show in My Account Menu field, and then click Save.
Create the CC Menu record for the My Account menu.
On the CC Menu tab in your org, click New.
For Display Name, enter an internal-only name for the menu record, such as My Account Menu for Header.
NOTE This value doesn't display on the storefront. To change the value for the My Account link that displays in the storefront header, update the corresponding page label.
For Store ID, enter the name of the storefront where you want the menu to appear.
For Sequence, enter any integer value.
NOTE A storefront supports only one CC Menu record where Show in My Account Menu is enabled. When a storefront has more than one CC Menu record where this field is enabled, the record with the lowest Sequence value has priority.
Enter a valid Start Date and End Date range, and select Enabled.
In the Link section, select None for Link Type.
Click Save.
Create the CC Menu Item records for the sections of the My Account menu that you want to support.
On the CC Menu record that you created, scroll to the CC Menu Items related list, and click New.
For Display Name, enter the the value that you want to show on the storefront, such as Contact Information.
NOTE This behavior differs from the Display Name field on the parent CC Menu record, which specifies an internal-only name for the record.
To specify the position of the menu item in the parent menu, enter a Sequence value.
NOTE To determine the order of menu items shown in the menu, B2B Commerce compares the Sequence values of all menu items with the same parent menu. For example, let’s say that you have two menu items: one menu item has a sequence of 100, and the other has a sequence of 200. The menu item with the value 100 displays first, and the menu item with the value 200 displays second.
Enter a valid Start Date and End Date range, and select Enabled.
Scroll to the Parent section, and make sure that the menu record you previously created is selected.
Scroll to the Link section, and select URL for Link Type.
For URL, enter the relative path to the section of the My Account page, including the appropriate value for the viewState parameter, such as /DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=viewAccount.
Repeat these steps to create menu items with the following values:
TIP
If your storefront doesn't support certain sections of the My Account page, skip the CC Menu Item records for the sections that you aren't using.
These menus and menu items support other options and internationalization workflows that you can specify for standard menus.
DISPLAY NAME	SEQUENCE	URL
Contact Information	100	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=viewAccount
Change Password	200	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=changePassword
Manage Address Books	300	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=myAddressBook
My Carts	400	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=myCarts
My Orders	500	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=myOrders
My Templates	600	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=myWishlists
My Subscriptions	700	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=mySubscriptionsNew
My Wallet	800	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=myWallet
My Invoices	900	/DefaultStore/ccrz__MyAccount?viewState=myInvoices
Refresh the menu cache.

title: Configuring My Account Menu in B2B Commerce for Visualforce
